mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The original house was completed in 1866 for Sir Frederic Leighton. The Arab Hall was part of the 1879 addition for Leighton. It is based on drawings made by Aitchison in Spain and includes tiles from Rhodes, Damascus, and Cairo dating from the 13th, 16th, and 17th centuries. There is a frieze by Walter Crane. Upon Leighton's death, the house was gifted to London and converted to an art gallery. The house suffered some damage during WWII and after restoration it was reopened in 1951. [work]
